AzureBlade: He hides it, but it is there, in his spark... I will 
try...
He crawls to where Skullgrin lies
AzureBlade: Sentient beings can make poor decisions, but those of 
leaders are possibly more dire than those of simple soldiers...
He lays hands on Skullgrin, and, through his mind, he speaks to the 
decepticon:
Please, warrior, hear me out. I am Protoform Z. (his spark stimulated 
what good he could find in Skullgrin) You have fought well, and you 
deserve to continue the life you lived. Do you want to know what I 
offer you?

Outside of this communication, his body was in a lock. Alpha and Hell 
Drak could probably see he reacted to nothing...

--- In nbwrpg@y..., airly2000@y... wrote:
> Alphah::
> 
> Alpha ignoredMegatron and answered to Azure Blade "Yeah Decepticons 
> are too kind that reprograms  your friends as decepticons. that the 
> signal of his kidness"
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> > "If he would have chosen to go back with you then he would have 
> made the
> > wrong choice." Megatron turned his back on Alpha, ignoring the 
> battle
> > field. "Sentient beings tend to make poor decisions, perhaps you 
> belong
> > with your friend," Megatron turned his head and smiled, "on this 
> side."
